comments.body:
a callback parameter should not be optional. this should be:
```ts
callback: (res: boolean, code: number, message: string) => void) => void;
```

Hi @mhegazy , thanks for suggestion!

But if I set the rest parameters required, declaration is not backward compatible. All the existing codes cannot pass the compilation.

This change seems like a bug. In my testing the `on()` callbacks have not been changed to use the new `ErrorEvent`, it looks like it's only `onerror` and `addEventListener`.

Are you sure this change is correct?
@bradleyayers You're totally right.. My bad... What is the right procedure to fix this ? To do another PR just to correct the on.('error') event ?
